nomenclature.name: Calamus nambariensis
nomenclature.author: Becc.
nomenclature.citation: Ann. Roy. Bot. Gard. Calcutta 11:433. 1908 &Appendix PI. 193, 194. 1913

treatment.div: A robust climber; stem cluster forming, with leafsheath to 4 cm in diameter. Leaves cirrate, to 3 m long; leafsheath with distinct knee, armed with broadly subulate, subseriate, horizontal to deflexed spines; petiole about 30 cm long, flattened upper, armed at margins with 2 - 3 cm long subulate spines; rachis with strong digitate claws on lowerr side; leaflets lanceolate, ensiform, variously spreading, remotely subequidistant; each about 50 cm long, 4 cm broad at middle, usually 5-nerved, nerves more or less smooth. Male inflorescence simply decompound; partial inflorescences with alternatre, 3 - 4 cm long rachillae; each with distinct cushion at the base, arching above; male flowers 3 mm long, 14-15 male flowers on each side of the rachillae; female rachillae sinuous, incurved, about 6-10 cm long, attached at the mouth of the basal bract. Fruit globose, 2.5 cm in diameter; fruit scales in 21 series; fruiting perianth pedicelliform.
Infrequent in the moist forests of Assam Valley.
Cane is strong, exported from Assam to other states for making furniture frames.
Assam : Jeypore, Feb. 1877, Nambar forest, Silviculturist (CAL); Assam : Jeypore, 15.12.1896, Silviculture Range (one sheet in DD). No recent collection available.
